greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Extended triangle related to the asymptotic expansions of the E(x,m=2,n).
comment: This triangle is the same as triangle A165674 except for the extra left-hand column a(n,0) = n!. The a(n) formulas for the right-hand columns generate the coefficients of this extra left-hand column, see A080663, A165676, A165677, A165678 and A165679.
_Leroy Quet_ discovered triangle A105954 which is the reversal of our triangle.
In square format, row k gives the (n-1)-st elementary symmetric function of {k,k+1,k+2,...,k+n}, as in the Mathematica section. [_Clark Kimberling_, Dec 29 2011]
maple: nmax := 8; for n from 0 to nmax do a(n, 0) := n! od: for n from 0 to nmax do a(n, n) := 1 od: for n from 2 to nmax do for m from 1 to n-1 do a(n, m) := (n-m+1)*a(n-1, m) + a(n-1, m-1) od: od: seq(seq(a(n, m), m=0..n), n=0..nmax); # _Johannes W. Meijer_, revised Nov 27 2012
mathematica: t = {t1, t2, t3, t4, t5, t6, t7, t8, t9, t10}; TableForm[t]  (* A165675 in square format *)
xref: A105954 is the reversal of this triangle.
A165674, A138771 and A165680 are related triangles.
A080663 equals the third right hand column.
A000142 equals the first left hand column.
results.author: _Johannes W. Meijer_, Oct 05 2009
